result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Michael Cork Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by 08-09-17. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Michael Cork Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 53 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 08-09-2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:     
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Kevin Michael Cork in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Kevin Michael Cork not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defense request a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned for a PLEA AND SENTENCING in branch 38.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, in room 423 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Kevin Michael Cork in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Kevin Michael Cork in custody.  John Flynn for Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 06.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 06.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

State is requesting court set bail at $5,000.00 cash bail.  Defense has no additional information to provide and request to address bail at a later date.  Court orders bail set a $5,000.00 with turn over to JusticePoint.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Kevin Michael Cork not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court vacates the warrant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 6/16/2016. Bench Warrant in file. Case is adjourned on 6/22/2016for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 6. Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

Filed, JusticePoint Discharge Summary Report.
jad
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  Brandon Wigley for Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/20/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Court orders defendant to comply with Sex Offender Registry. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kevin Michael Cork in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Kevin Michael Cork in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
